001package io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.log;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.utilities.logging.LogCore;
004
005/**
006 * Provides structured logging utilities for test execution.
007 *
008 * <p>This class extends {@code LogCore} and offers various logging levels tailored
009 * for test execution, including information, warnings, errors, debugging, tracing,
010 * and validation-specific logs.
011 *
012 * <p>The logging is categorized under the "ROA.QUEST" namespace, ensuring test-related logs
013 * are distinguishable from other logs in the system.
014 *
015 * <p>This class follows the singleton pattern, ensuring that only one instance of
016 * {@code LogQuest} exists.
017 *
018 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
019 */
020public final class LogQuest extends LogCore {
021
022   private static LogQuest instance;
023
024   /**
025    * Private constructor to enforce singleton pattern.
026    * Initializes the logger with a predefined namespace.
027    */
028   private LogQuest() {
029      super("ROA.TEST", "QUEST");
030   }
031
032   /**
033    * Logs an informational message.
034    *
035    * @param message The log message template.
036    * @param args    The arguments to be formatted into the message.
037    */
038   public static void info(String message, Object... args) {
039      getInstance().infoLog(message, args);
040   }
041
042   /**
043    * Logs a warning message.
044    *
045    * @param message The log message template.
046    * @param args    The arguments to be formatted into the message.
047    */
048   public static void warn(String message, Object... args) {
049      getInstance().warnLog(message, args);
050   }
051
052   /**
053    * Logs an error message.
054    *
055    * @param message The log message template.
056    * @param args    The arguments to be formatted into the message.
057    */
058   public static void error(String message, Object... args) {
059      getInstance().errorLog(message, args);
060   }
061
062   /**
063    * Logs a debug message.
064    *
065    * @param message The log message template.
066    * @param args    The arguments to be formatted into the message.
067    */
068   public static void debug(String message, Object... args) {
069      getInstance().debugLog(message, args);
070   }
071
072   /**
073    * Logs a trace-level message.
074    *
075    * @param message The log message template.
076    * @param args    The arguments to be formatted into the message.
077    */
078   public static void trace(String message, Object... args) {
079      getInstance().traceLog(message, args);
080   }
081
082   /**
083    * Logs a step in the test execution process.
084    *
085    * @param message The log message template.
086    * @param args    The arguments to be formatted into the message.
087    */
088   public static void step(String message, Object... args) {
089      getInstance().stepLog(message, args);
090   }
091
092   /**
093    * Logs a validation-specific message.
094    *
095    * @param message The log message template.
096    * @param args    The arguments to be formatted into the message.
097    */
098   public static void validation(String message, Object... args) {
099      getInstance().validationLog(message, args);
100   }
101
102   /**
103    * Logs an extended test execution message.
104    *
105    * @param message The log message template.
106    * @param args    The arguments to be formatted into the message.
107    */
108   public static void extended(String message, Object... args) {
109      getInstance().extendedLog(message, args);
110   }
111
112   /**
113    * Retrieves the singleton instance of {@code LogQuest}.
114    *
115    * @return The singleton instance of {@code LogQuest}.
116    */
117   private static LogQuest getInstance() {
118      if (instance == null) {
119         instance = new LogQuest();
120      }
121      return instance;
122   }
123
124}
